description: '''Arabesque''' ({{langx|tr|Arabesk}}) is a style of [[Music of Turkey|Turkish music]] popular in [[Turkey]], the [[Balkans]], the [[The Caucasus|Caucasus]], the [[Middle East]], and [[Eastern Europe]]. The genre was particularly popular in Turkey from the 1960s through the 2000s. Its aesthetics have evolved over the decades and into the 2010s. It often includes the [[baÄŸlama]] and [[Middle Eastern music]]. Arabesque music is mostly in a minor key, typically in varieties of the [[Phrygian mode]]; it heavily features themes that tend to focus on issues of longing, strife, and desire.
